paper_abstract: This paper studies the geometric decay property of the joint queue-length distribution {p(n(1), n(2))} of a two-node Markovian queueing system in the steady state. For arbitrarily given positive integers c(1), c(2), d(1) and d(2), an upper bound (eta) over bar (c(1), c(2)) of the decay rate is derived in the sense exp{lim sup n(n-->infinity)(-1) log p(c(1)n + d(1), c(2)n + d(2))} <= (eta) over bar (c(1), c(2)) < 1. It is shown that the upper bound coincides with the exact decay rate in most systems for which the exact decay rate is known. Moreover, as a function of c(1) and c(2), <(eta)over bar>(c(1), c(2)) takes one of eight types, and the types explain some curious properties reported in Fujimoto and Takahashi (J. Oper. Res. Soc. Jpn. 39:525-540 1996).
paper_title: Upper bound for the decay rate of the joint queue-length distribution in a two-node Markovian queueing system
